column4: hey guys.  i'm a freelance developer.  i run an ubuntu server out of my house.  im having a hell of a time trying to get sendmail working.  i'm assuming this has something to do wth a combination of my isp blocking ports and my server not having a domain name pointing to it.  is there any way for me to get this going?
i'd really like to get it going for development purposes
im also running dd-wrt firmware on my linksys router
not familiar with them.. Are they a cable provider?
they most likely block the outgoing smtp ports or require authentication. have you tried calling them about it?
can sendmail be configured this way?
sendmail would have to be configured that way. Unless you provide your own internet service your going to have to use someone's smtp ports
thank i saw that link but im not using postfix, im using sendmail

even though you want to use this as "development or testing" you might be breaking your ISP agreement by setting such a server up. I wouldnt want to see you get in trouble for this, so I would advise you speak with your ISP on the matter. I believe this has something to do with the patriot act (logging ISP of all people sending e-mails) something about spammers
